{-
    Various Parsers needed for everyday work.
    `parseHandshake`      : Parse the Handshake coming from a Module.
    `parseIRC`            : Parse a raw IRC Message String.
    `parseIRCFunctionCall`: Parse an IRC Message directed to the Bot.
    `parseAlias`          : Parse the Native :alias <alias> <command> operation
    `getTime`             : Get Microseconds from "<int>{s|sec|min|h|d}"
-}
module Koncat.Parsers (
    parseHandshake
  , parseIRC
  , parseIRCFunctionCall
  , runFuncParser
  , getTime
  , parseAlias
  , defaultValues
) where

import           Koncat.Types
import           Koncat.Core.API(nick)
import           Text.ParserCombinators.Parsec
import           Data.Maybe 
import qualified Data.List       as L
import qualified Data.Map        as Map


-- ----------
-- parseHandshake gets the raw text as recieved when asking a module
-- for a handshake, parses it and stuffs it in the Handshake Data Type.

parseHandshake :: String -> Handshake
parseHandshake s = Handshake 
                   { desc     = putDesc       t 
                   , funcs    = runFuncParser (putFunc t)
                   , author   = putAuthor     t
                   }
 where
   t = tail $ splitH s 
                   
-- ----------                   
-- The following 6 functions dedicate to parsing the Functions the Module
-- sends over.
-- Figure 1 displays how such a message should look like.
-- |----------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
-- | $F={helloworld:[A Hello World Function](*String)$E=5s$P=Admin;other_func:...     |
-- |  \1 \2          \3                      \4      \5   \6       \7                 |
-- |\                                                                                 |
-- || 1) A capital "F" (ASCII Value 0x46) initiates the Function segment              |
-- || 2) The Function Name. This value will later be put in the modules STDIN         |
-- ||    in order to call the function.                                               |
-- || 3) The description of the Function. This value will later be used in            |
-- ||    :help and :list core functions. Note that this value is non-optional!        |
-- || 4) Arguments. Semantics for this will be elaborated in "Module.hs" later on.    |
-- || 5) Optional Execution time of the function.                                     |
-- ||    Valid units are {s,sec,min,h,d}.                                             |
-- ||    If not set, the maximum execution time is set to 60 seconds.                 |
-- ||    If unsure about the execution time of the function, for example because of   |
-- ||    doing an Network activity, you can use the -daemonize switch in IRC to       |
-- ||    disable Execution time checking.                                             |
-- || 6) Permissions. If not set this will be ANY, making the function available to   |
-- ||    everyone. Possible units are {ANY,Admin,Registered,Privileged}               |
-- || 7) Functions are delimeted with a semicolon (ASCII Value 0x3B)                  |
-- |---------------------------------FIG 1.-------------------------------------------|

runFuncParser :: String -> [(String, String, String, Maybe [(Char, String)])]
runFuncParser s = case parse parseFunc "(mod-stdin)" s of
    Left e  -> [("E","E",show e, Nothing)] 
    Right a -> a

parseFunc :: Parser [(String, String, String, Maybe [(Char, String)])]
parseFunc = do
    char '{'
    x <- oneFunc `sepEndBy` char ';'
    char '}'
    return x

oneFunc :: Parser (String, String, String, Maybe [(Char, String)])    
oneFunc = do
    name <- getName
    desc <- getDesc
    args <- getArgs
    let hasArgs = if args == ""
            then "Void"
            else args
    modifierVars <- getVariables
    return (name, desc, hasArgs, modifierVars)

getName :: Parser String
getName = do
    content <- many1 $ noneOf ": "
    char ':'
    return content

getDesc :: Parser String
getDesc = do
    char '['
    content <- many $ noneOf "]"
    char ']'
    return content

getArgs :: Parser String
getArgs = do
    char '(' 
    content <- many $ noneOf ")"
    char ')'
    return content

getVariables :: Parser (Maybe [(Char, String)])
getVariables = optionMaybe (char '%' >> sepBy oneVariable (char '%'))

oneVariable :: Parser ((Char,String))
oneVariable = do
    c <- anyChar
    char '='
    cnt <- many $ (noneOf "%;}")
    return (c,cnt)

-- The following lookup Table describes Default values for variables.
-- They will be inserted in the SQL Database if the user didn't set it!
defaultValues :: [(Char, String)]
defaultValues = [ ('E', show $ 60 * 10 ^ 6 )
                , ('P', "ANY") ]

-- ----------
-- The following function dedicates to parsing everything but the actual message
-- the Bot recieves from IRC, and stuffs it in the GenericIRC type.
-- |----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
-- | :tsv!tsv@localhost PRIVMSG #main :This is the actual message               |
-- | \1   \2  \3                \4     \5                                       |
-- |\                                                                           |
-- || 1) Nickname (GenericIRC {UserInfo{name}})                                 |
-- || 2) Realname (GenericIRC {UserInfo{rName}})                                |
-- || 3) vhost    (GenericIRC {UserInfo{vhost}})                                |
-- || 4) Channel  (GenericIRC {orig})                                           |
-- || 5) Message  (GenericIRC {msg})                                            |
-- | See RFC 1459 @ http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc1459.html for further reference |
-- |-----------------------------------FIG 2.-----------------------------------|

parseIRC :: String -> GenericIRC
parseIRC s = GenericIRC { user = UserInfo { name  = fromTo ':' '!' user
                                          , rName = fromTo '!' '@' user
                                          , vhost = drop 1 $ dropWhile (/= '@') user
                                          }
                        , orig = target
                        , msg  = args
                        } 
  where
    splitted = words s
    user     = splitted !! 0 
    target   = if (splitted !! 2) == nick
                   then fromTo ':' '!' user
                   else splitted !! 2
    args     = [drop 1 . head $ drop 3 splitted] ++ drop 4 splitted

-- ----------
-- The following 8 functions dedicate to parsing an IRC message
-- which is directed to the Bot.
-- Unless a core function is called (:list, :help etc.) (handled earlier)
-- a valid function call looks like this:
-- -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
-- | <+nick> :util.testytest #dothingsheh(Arg1,Arg2) -flag -flag2=SomeArgument |
-- |          \1              \2          \3          \4                       | 
-- |\                                                                          |
-- || 1) Module Name   (IRCCommand{qModule})                                   |
-- || 2) Function Name (IRCCommand{qFunc})                                     |
-- || 3) Arguments     (IRCCommand{qArgs})                                     |
-- || 4) Flags         (IRCCommand{qFlags})                                    |
-- | NOTE: Arguments and Flags are optional (Implementation via Maybe)         |
-- --------------------------------FIG 3.---------------------------------------

parseIRCFunctionCall :: String -> Either ParseError IRCCommand
parseIRCFunctionCall input = parse functionCall "(ircin)" input

funcIllegal = "#(); "

functionCall = do { 
    char ':' 
  ; modName <- many (noneOf funcIllegal)
  ; spaces
  ; fName <- funcInfo
  ; flags <- getFlags
  ; return IRCCommand { qModule = modName
                      , qFunc   = fst fName
                      , qArgs   = isEmpty $ snd fName
                      , qFlags  = fIsEmpty flags
                      }
  }
  where
    isEmpty s = case s of
        [[]]  -> Nothing
        a     -> Just a

    fIsEmpty s = case s of
        [] -> Nothing
        a  -> Just a

funcInfo = 
    do { try (char '#')
       ; fname <- many (noneOf "( ")
       ; char '('
       ; args <- getFuncArgs
       ; char ')'
       ; return (fname, args)
       } 
    <?> "function (#func(..))"   
  
getFlags :: Parser [(String, Maybe String)]
getFlags = tFlags `sepBy` spaces

tFlags = 
    do { spaces 
       ; skipMany1 $ char '-'
       ; cnt <- many (noneOf " =")
       ; skipMany (space <|> char '=')
       ; val <- optionMaybe (quotedContents <|> (many1 $ noneOf " -"))
       ; spaces
       ; return (cnt, val)
       }
getFuncArgs = sepBy (many(noneOf ",)")) separator

separator = skipMany1 (space <|> char ',')

quotedContents = do
    char '\'' <|> char '"'
    cnt <- (many $ noneOf "'\\\"") 
    char '\'' <|> char '"'
    return cnt

parseAlias :: String -> (String, String)
parseAlias s = case parse aliasParse "(ircin)" s of
    Left e  -> ("E", show e)
    Right v -> v

aliasParse :: Parser (String, String)
aliasParse = do
    spaces
    tFst <- quotedContents
    spaces
    tSnd <- quotedContents
    spaces
    return (tFst, tSnd)
-- ----------
splitH :: String -> [String]
splitH input = case parse roughParse "(mod-stdin)" input of
    Left e  -> [[]]
    Right v -> v

roughParse = sepBy (many (noneOf "$\n")) $ char '$'   
-- ----------

-- Identify a variable, ex $E=Some Value -> Just "Some Value"
identPart :: Char -> [String] -> Maybe String
identPart c x = case filter (\x -> head x == c) x of
    [] -> Nothing
    [a]  -> Just (drop 2 a)

-- Get the description.
-- The description is required, so throw an error if there is no description.
putDesc :: [String] -> String
putDesc a = fromJust $ identPart 'D' a

getTime :: String -> Int
getTime t = case unit of
    "s"   -> num         * 10 ^ 6
    "sec" -> num         * 10 ^ 6 
    "min" -> num * 60    * 10 ^ 6
    "h"   -> num * 3600  * 10 ^ 6
    "d"   -> num * 86400 * 10 ^ 6
    _     -> 60          * 10 ^ 6
 where
   unit = dropWhile (`notElem` ['a'..'z']) t
   num  = read $ takeWhile (`notElem` ['a'..'z']) t
               
putAuthor :: [String] -> String
putAuthor a = case identPart 'A' a of
    Nothing -> "Unknown"
    Just a  -> a

putFunc :: [String] -> String
putFunc a = fromJust $ identPart 'F' a

-- Extract a part of a string
fromTo :: Char -> Char -> String -> String
fromTo a b c = drop 1 . takeWhile (/= b) $ dropWhile (/= a) c

-- Safely extract a part of a String, checking if a and b are existant.
sFromTo :: Char -> Char -> String -> Maybe String
sFromTo a b c = if start == -1 || end == -1 then
                   Nothing
               else Just $ drop 1 . takeWhile (/= b) $ dropWhile (/= a) c
  where
    start = fromMaybe (-1) $ L.elemIndex a c
    end   = fromMaybe (-1) $ L.elemIndex b c
